text: De Bello Gallico or Commentarii de Bello Gallico is a book by Julius Caesar. Its name means "Of the Gallic Wars." It is about how he fought battles and conquered Gaul. Today, we call Gaul France, Germany, Switzerland and Belgium. Julius Caesar wrote this book in Latin in the year 8 CE. Vercingetorix appears in this book. ==Summary== ===Book 1=== The whole land of Gaul is split into three parts. ==Other websites== *De Bello Gallico translated into English at MIT ==References== Category:Classical Roman literature Category:History books Category:1st-century books Category:Gaul
title: Commentarii de Bello Gallico
